str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Tomorrow. From epi and aurion; occurring on the succeeding day, i.e. to-morrow.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of para and emballo; a throwing in beside, i.e., battle-array, encampment or barracks.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To allow, permit, let alone, leave. Of uncertain affinity; to let be, i.e. Permit or leave alone.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A horse-soldier, a mounted soldier, a cavalryman. From hippos; an equestrian, i.e. Member of a cavalry corps.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
